title: CRITICAL: SDF and pressure cell types are decoupled
description:
## Problem
SDF is used ONLY for particle collision. Pressure solver cell types come from particle counts and domain boundaries, NOT from SDF values.

## Impact
- Particle could be inside SDF solid but in a FLUID cell
- Pressure solver doesn't 'see' the obstacle
- Flow can exist where SDF says solid
- Moving obstacles affect collision but not pressure

## Location
- `fluid_cell_expand_3d.wgsl` line 74-77: domain boundary marking
- `flip_3d.rs`: upload_bc_and_cell_types separate from upload_sdf

## Fix
Derive cell types from SDF values, or synchronize SDF-to-cell-type on updates.

title: Particles can tunnel through thin geometry (< 2 cells)
description:
## Problem
SDF penetration correction is clamped to 2*cell_size per frame. Fast particles tunneling through thin geometry (< 2 cells) won't be fully ejected.

## Location
`sdf_collision_3d.wgsl` line 168

## Impact
Particles can escape through thin walls and never return.

## Fix
Remove 2*cell_size limit or add sub-stepping for deep penetrations.

title: Sediment particles bypass SDF collision entirely
description:
## Problem
In sdf_collision_3d.wgsl, the condition `if (!is_sediment)` means sediment particles NEVER undergo SDF collision response. They rely entirely on DEM.

## Location
`sdf_collision_3d.wgsl` line 163

## Impact
If DEM collision is disabled or misconfigured, sediment passes through solid geometry.

## Fix
Either enable SDF collision for sediment, or ensure DEM always handles sediment-solid collision.

title: Deposition suppression too aggressive in shallow water
description:
## Problem
Deposition is overly suppressed in shallow water conditions, preventing natural sediment accumulation even when flow velocity is low.

## Location
`crates/sim3d/src/world.rs` - deposition calculation

## Impact
Unrealistic sediment transport, gold doesn't settle in shallows.

## Solution
Review deposition threshold and shallow water handling.

title: Pressure solver has no convergence monitoring
description:
## Problem
Pressure solver runs exactly 40 iterations with no residual check. May under-iterate, over-iterate, or diverge silently.

## Location
`flip_3d.rs` line 4167: `self.pressure.encode(encoder, 40)`

## Impact
- Wastes GPU cycles if converged early
- Produces garbage if system is diverging
- 40 iterations may be insufficient for large domains

## Fix
Add residual reduction pass, terminate early if converged, warn if diverging.

title: Shear stress calculation adds two incompatible formulas
description:
## Problem
Shear stress combines gravity term and velocity term additively, but these are ALTERNATIVE formulations for the same quantity.

## Location
`world.rs` lines 520-524

## Current (wrong)
```rust
let grav_term = g * water_depth * slope;
let velocity_term = cf * (vx*vx + vz*vz);
let shear_stress = rho * (grav_term + velocity_term);  // WRONG: additive
```

## Correct
Choose ONE approach:
- Slope-based: tau = rho * g * h * S
- OR Velocity-based: tau = rho * Cf * v^2

## Fix
Use velocity-based formula only (more accurate for non-uniform flow).

title: Fixed-point atomic overflow risk in P2G scatter
description:
## Problem
In `p2g_scatter_3d.wgsl`, fixed-point atomics use SCALE=1,000,000 with i32 max ~2.1e9. With high particle counts (100k+) accumulating in single cells, overflow is possible.

## Location
`crates/game/src/gpu/shaders/p2g_scatter_3d.wgsl`

## Risk
Silent data corruption, unstable simulation.

## Solution
Use i64 atomics or reduce SCALE factor with saturation checks.

title: CRITICAL: Cell type constant mismatch between multigrid and main shaders
description:
## Problem
Multigrid pressure solver shaders use CELL_SOLID=0, but main 3D shaders use CELL_SOLID=2. This causes completely wrong boundary conditions.

## Locations
- mg_smooth.wgsl, mg_residual.wgsl, mg_prolongate.wgsl, mg_restrict.wgsl, pcg_ops.wgsl: CELL_SOLID=0
- All main shaders (p2g, g2p, pressure, etc.): CELL_SOLID=2

## Impact
- AIR cells (0) treated as SOLID in multigrid
- SOLID cells (2) treated as AIR
- Completely wrong pressure solve with multigrid preconditioner

## Fix
Unify all shaders to use CELL_SOLID=2 (or 0, but consistently).

title: Parallel array desync between sediment_flip_indices and dem.clumps
description:
## Problem
When multiple sediment particles are deleted in one frame, swap_remove on parallel arrays (sediment_flip_indices and dem.clumps) can desync them.

## Location
`main.rs` lines 744-791

## Mechanism
1. Delete particle at index 100, sediment_pos=5
2. clumps.swap_remove(5) - clump 8 moves to 5
3. sediment_flip_indices.swap_remove(5) - index 8 moves to 5
4. Delete particle at index 50, sediment_pos=3
5. clumps.swap_remove(3) - clump 7 moves to 3
6. BUT clump 7 was ALREADY remapped in step 2!

## Impact
Wrong DEM clumps receive FLIP velocities. Sediment physics corruption.

## Fix
Use generational indices or store DEM clump index directly in FLIP particle.

title: Replace linked-list spatial hash
description: Use prefix-sum dense array instead of linked-list. 15-20% speedup expected.

title: Missing architecture documentation
description:
## Problem
No high-level architecture overview. New developers cannot understand system structure. Missing documentation for:
- GPU pipeline stages
- Data flow between CPU/GPU
- Shader organization
- Sediment physics model

## Solution
Create docs/ARCHITECTURE.md with diagrams and explanations.

title: GPU/CPU state divergence in async readback
description:
## Problem
Async GPU readback with double-buffered slots can leave CPU state stale for 2+ frames. If GPU fails to signal completion, CPU may read garbage or outdated data.

## Location
`crates/game/src/gpu/flip_3d.rs` - ReadbackSlot logic

## Risk
Corrupted particle data, physics glitches.

## Solution
Add fence synchronization or timeout detection with graceful degradation.

title: rand_float() race condition with unsafe static mut
description:
## Problem
`rand_float()` uses unsafe static mutable SEED. This is undefined behavior if called from multiple threads, and fragile even in single-threaded code.

## Location
`crates/game/src/main.rs` lines 1585-1591

## Solution
Use `fastrand` crate or `thread_local!` with Cell. This duplicates todo 037 but records it in beads.

title: Test coverage at 40% - critical paths untested
description:
## Problem
Overall test coverage is ~40%. 80% of public functions lack tests. No property-based testing for physics invariants.

## Critical gaps
- P2G/G2P shader logic
- Pressure solver convergence
- Sediment transport physics
- Async readback paths

## Solution
Add unit tests for critical paths, consider proptest for physics.

title: No GPU device lost handling - will panic
description:
## Problem
No device lost callbacks. When GPU device is lost (power event, driver crash, timeout), all operations fail and current unwrap() calls cascade into panics.

## Pattern
Every buffer map uses:
```rust
rx.recv().unwrap().unwrap();  // Double unwrap - channel AND map result
```

## Affected Files
flip_3d.rs, g2p_3d.rs, p2g_3d.rs, sph_3d.rs, mgpcg.rs, heightfield.rs

## Fix
Add device lost callback, wrap buffer maps in Result, propagate errors.

title: NaN propagation risk in velocity normalization
description:
## Problem
Division by weight sum in G2P can produce NaN if weight is zero. NaN then propagates through simulation corrupting all data.

## Location
`crates/game/src/gpu/shaders/g2p_3d.wgsl`

## Solution
Add epsilon to denominator or skip update when weight < epsilon.

title: DEM velocity sync overwrites FLIP drag and settling
description:
## Problem
G2P shader applies drag and settling to sediment. Then DEM collision_response_only replaces velocity entirely on collision. The physics are applied twice or partially overwritten.

## Location
- `g2p_3d.wgsl` lines 339-359: applies drag, settling
- `clump.rs` line 497: velocity = new_v_normal + new_v_tangent (complete replacement)

## Impact
Inconsistent sediment physics depending on collision state.

## Fix
Have DEM only apply velocity CHANGES from collision, not replace entirely.

title: CRITICAL: Pressure solver has fixed diagonal=6, violates SPD property
description:
## Problem
Pressure solver always divides by 6 regardless of actual neighbor count. Cells with fewer fluid/air neighbors have wrong diagonal coefficient.

## Location
`pressure_3d.wgsl` lines 168, 253

## Math Error
For cell with only 1 fluid neighbor and 5 solid neighbors:
- Current: sum_neighbors/6 (wrong)
- Correct: sum_neighbors/1 (should divide by actual fluid neighbor count)

## Impact
- Loss of diagonal dominance
- Non-symmetric system
- Slow/non-convergent pressure solve
- Potential numerical instability

## Fix
Count actual fluid/air neighbors, use variable diagonal.

title: Merge DFSPH into sim crate
description: Consolidate DFSPH into main simulation crate.

title: DEM position correction uses 1.01x factor causing oscillation
description:
## Problem
When pushing particles out of solids, DEM adds 1% extra:
`clump.position += normal * penetration * 1.01`

This overshoots, and when FLIP re-integrates, particle moves back, causing oscillation.

## Location
`clump.rs` line 480

## Fix
Use exactly penetration, or implement proper depenetration scheme.

title: Pressure gradient zeros at riffle faces
description: Pressure solver does not correctly handle gradients at fluid-solid boundaries.

title: Water spawns at exact riffle top height
description: Water particles spawn at y=0.44m, same height as first riffle top. Geometrically impossible for water to overflow.

title: Double-free risk in ReadbackSlot::try_read()
description:
## Problem
If `try_read()` is called twice before new data is written, it may return the same buffer twice or trigger use-after-free if buffer is recycled.

## Location
`crates/game/src/gpu/flip_3d.rs` - ReadbackSlot implementation

## Risk
Memory corruption, undefined behavior.

## Solution
Add consumed flag or use Option<T> to ensure single consumption.

title: GPU settling velocity ignores particle diameter (100x error possible)
description:
## Problem
GPU FLIP uses density-only scaling for settling velocity. Stokes law scales with d^2, giving 100x difference between 0.1mm and 1mm particles.

## Location
`g2p_3d.wgsl` lines 351-357, `g2p_3d.rs` lines 36-38

## Current (wrong)
```wgsl
settling_velocity = base * (density - 1.0);  // No diameter!
```

## Correct (world.rs has it right)
```rust
vs_stokes = g * (rho_p - rho_f) * d^2 / (18 * mu);
```

## Fix
Add particle diameter to GPU struct, use physical settling formula.

title: Gold settling has arbitrary 2x multiplier (wrong physics)
description:
## Problem
Gold settling velocity is multiplied by 2.0 for no physical reason. This makes gold settle 22x faster than sand instead of correct 11x.

## Location
`g2p_3d.wgsl` line 354

## Current
```wgsl
if (is_gold) {
    vel_after_drag.y -= settling_velocity * 2.0;  // WHY 2.0?
}
```

## Physics
Gold/sand ratio at same diameter should be:
(19300-1000)/(2650-1000) = 11.09x

Current gives: 18.3 * 2.0 / 1.65 = 22.2x (2x too high)

## Fix
Remove the arbitrary *2.0 multiplier.

title: Zero cell size divide-by-zero in grid initialization
description:
## Problem
If cell_size is accidentally set to 0, multiple divisions will cause panic or infinity values.

## Location
Grid initialization in various modules

## Solution
Validate cell_size > 0 at construction time with descriptive error.

title: CFL violation - particles travel 2 cells/step
description: CFL ~2.0, should be <1.0. Fix with smaller timestep or sub-stepping.

title: Implement velocity extrapolation (honey-water fix)
description: Critical fix for honey-water behavior. ~2% momentum loss per frame at fluid boundaries. Tests written in crates/sim/tests/velocity_extrapolation_tests.rs. See plans/velocity-extrapolation-implementation.md for detailed pseudocode.

title: Open boundaries handled inconsistently across shaders
description:
## Problem
open_boundaries bitmask is respected in some shaders but ignored in others.

## Locations
- pressure_3d.wgsl: ignores open_boundaries for out-of-bounds (always Neumann)
- pressure_gradient_3d.wgsl: correctly respects open_boundaries
- fluid_cell_expand_3d.wgsl: always marks domain boundaries as SOLID regardless of open flag

## Impact
Flow cannot exit through 'open' boundaries. Pressure backs up at outlets.

## Fix
Consistently apply open_boundaries flag in all boundary-handling shaders.

title: Fix gaps in deposited piles
description: DEM settling produces piles with occasional holes. Polish issue.

title: GPU-CPU roundtrip inefficiency
description: Grid velocities round-trip through CPU. Wastes 290KB/frame. Share buffers between P2G and G2P.

title: P2G momentum ignores particle mass (density)
description:
## Problem
P2G accumulates (vel + C*offset) * weight, but doesn't multiply by particle mass. Sediment (density > 1) contributes same momentum as water.

## Location
`p2g_scatter_3d.wgsl` lines 160-171

## Physics
FLIP/APIC should use: momentum = m_p * w * (v_p + C_p * offset)
where m_p = density * volume_per_particle

## Impact
Sediment doesn't contribute proportionally more momentum to grid.

## Fix
Add mass weighting: let mass = density * particle_volume.

title: Fast sweeping produces Manhattan distances, not Euclidean
description:
## Problem
SDF generation uses fast sweeping which propagates axis-aligned distances. At corners/edges, distances are overestimated.

## Location
`grid.rs` lines 472-476: sweep uses nval + dx for propagation

## Impact
Particles can approach corners more closely than expected. Collision normals at corners may be wrong.

## Fix
Use true Euclidean fast sweeping or post-process with Eikonal solver.

title: CRITICAL: DEM desynchronized from FLIP substeps
description:
## Problem
DEM collision response runs ONCE per frame with full dt (1/60s), while FLIP runs 2 substeps. Also, DEM critical timestep is 0.004s but collision_response_only uses 0.0167s (4x above critical).

## Location
- `main.rs` line 651: run_dem_and_cleanup called once per frame
- `clump.rs` line 377-378: substeps = 8 in step(), but collision_response_only has no substeps

## Impact
- Sediment particles penetrate solids between DEM calls
- DEM spring-damper is unstable at 4x critical timestep
- FLIP and DEM are out of sync

## Fix
Move DEM collision response inside FLIP substep loop, use dt_sub not full dt.

title: Consider SoA particle layout
description: 64-byte struct but most loops need 16 bytes. Defer until 100K+ particles.

title: Sediment settling velocity scaling error (~18x amplification)
description:
## Problem
Settling velocity calculation has incorrect scaling. For gold particles (density 19300 kg/mÂ³), the current formula produces ~18x amplification versus physical reality.

## Location
`crates/sim3d/src/world.rs` - settling velocity calculation

## Impact
Gold settles unrealistically fast, affecting gameplay balance.

## Solution
Review Stokes law implementation and unit conversions.

title: Sediment particle index corruption after swap_remove
description:
## Problem
When particles are removed via `swap_remove`, the index of the swapped particle changes but references in sediment mapping may not be updated.

## Location
`crates/game/src/main.rs` line 779 area - sediment particle management

## Risk
Wrong particles receive sediment, physics corruption.

## Solution
Use stable indices (arena/generational) or update all references after swap.

title: CRITICAL: CFL violation - grid clamp at 10m/s allows CFL=8.3
description:
## Problem
Grid velocity is clamped at 10 m/s, but with cell_size=0.01m and dt_sub=1/120s, CFL should be < 1.0.

## Math
CFL = v * dt / dx = 10 * 0.0083 / 0.01 = 8.3 (should be < 1)
Comment in code says dx=0.025m but actual cell_size is 0.01m.

## Location
`sim3d/src/lib.rs` lines 204-225: MAX_GRID_VEL = 10.0

## Impact
Particles can advect 8+ cells per substep. Causes tunneling, instability.

## Fix
Lower MAX_GRID_VEL to ~1.0 m/s OR use adaptive timestep.
